text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1994, the PlayStation (PSX) is Sony's first video game console. It was the most popular console of its generation, and received a redesign in late 2000 called the PS One. It has a 32-bit RISC processor running at 34MHz, 2MB of RAM, 24 channel ADPCM sound output. Its resolution ranges from 256x224 to 640x480i in 16 million colors, and can calculate 360,000 vertex colored polygons (or 180,000 textured polygons) per second. The PSX features a catalog of more than 7,900 games including flagship franchises such as Resident Evil, Metal Gear, Gran Turismo and Final Fantasy.
